eligibleReasons.reason: Income at or below Kentucky Medicaid limit

nextSteps: Apply through kynect.ky.gov or local DCBS office
Apply through kynect.ky.gov or local DCBS office

eligibleReasons.reason: Disability diagnosis may qualify for SSI
High income may reduce SSI benefit amount
IDD diagnosis qualifies for waiver services

nextSteps: Contact Kentucky Department for Aging and Independent Living

eligibleReasons.reason: IDD diagnosis and age 18+ qualifies for HCB waiver

ineligibleReasons.reason: Must be 18 or older for HCB Waiver

nextSteps: Contact Kentucky Department for Aging and Independent Living
requiredDocuments: Documentation of disability or medical condition
Proof of age (must be 18 or older)

eligibleReasons.reason: IDD diagnosis and age 3+ qualifies for SCL waiver

ineligibleReasons.reason: Must be 3 or older for SCL Waiver

nextSteps: Contact Kentucky Department for Aging and Independent Living

benefitInteractions.description: Your private insurance and Medicaid can work together.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Keep your private insurance. Medicaid will work alongside it to reduce your out-of-pocket costs. Tell both your insurance company and Medicaid that you have dual coverage.

benefitInteractions.description: Getting SSI in Kentucky usually means you automatically qualify for Medicaid.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for SSI first â€” Medicaid may follow automatically without a separate application.

benefitInteractions.description: After receiving SSDI for 24 months, you automatically qualify for Medicare. If you also qualify for Medicaid, you can have both.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for both Medicaid and SSDI. After 2 years on SSDI, Medicare will be added automatically.

benefitInteractions.description: You need Medicaid to use the Michelle P Waiver. The waiver adds extra services on top of what Medicaid covers.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for Medicaid first, then apply for the Michelle P Waiver. Get on the waitlist as early as possible.

benefitInteractions.description: You need Medicaid to use the HCB Waiver. The waiver provides services in your home and community.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for Medicaid first, then get on the HCB Waiver waitlist. The wait can be long, so apply early.

benefitInteractions.description: You need Medicaid to use the SCL Waiver. SCL provides comprehensive community living supports.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for Medicaid first, then get on the SCL Waiver waitlist. You can be on multiple waiver waitlists.

benefitInteractions.description: SSI and SSDI are different programs. You may qualify for one or both depending on work history and income.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for both programs. They serve different purposes and can stack.

benefitInteractions.description: You can apply for both Medicaid and SNAP at the same time through kynect.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: One application at kynect.ky.gov can start both programs. This saves time.

benefitInteractions.description: SSI income counts toward SNAP eligibility. You may still qualify for SNAP.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for SNAP even if you receive SSI. Your SSI income will be counted, but you may still qualify.

actionPlanOrder.step: Apply for Medicaid first. Many other programs require Medicaid, and it unlocks waiver services.
Apply for SSI (Supplemental Security Income). In Kentucky, SSI often comes with automatic Medicaid.
actionPlanOrder.combinedStep: Apply for both SSI and SSDI through Social Security. They are different programs and you may qualify for both.

actionPlanOrder.step: Apply for SSDI (Social Security Disability Insurance). After 24 months, you will automatically get Medicare.
Get on the waiver waitlist(s). These programs often have long waits, so apply as early as possible. You can be on multiple lists.
Apply for SNAP (food assistance) at kynect.ky.gov or by calling 1-855-459-6328.
actionPlanOrder.withMedicaidStep: Apply for SNAP (food assistance). You can apply for SNAP and Medicaid together at kynect.ky.gov.

metadata.source: Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services
